question_text: Which statements accurately describe how SDRAM synchronization works? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: SDRAM uses a common system clock for timing data transfers
CPU and memory components stay synchronized through the shared clock signal
The synchronous design allows predictable data transfer timing
SDRAM eliminates the need for any clock signals
All memory operations occur at random intervals
correct_answer: SDRAM uses a common system clock for timing data transfers
CPU and memory components stay synchronized through the shared clock signal
The synchronous design allows predictable data transfer timing
explanation: SDRAM (Synchronous DRAM) synchronizes to a common clock, enabling predictable and coordinated data transfers between CPU and memory at high speeds.
